text: a month ago I made a post on the
community tab on my channel asking you
what questions you would have for a
Venezuelan gold farmer originally I had
intended to do the video with a
Venezuelan who had contacted me on

farm for gold I told him that I didn't
know and I couldn't help with that but I
also asked them how much money they
would need in runescape gold to feed
themselves for a week and he told me 30
mil would do and I ended up giving him
that money not just to help him but also
for selfish reasons I knew I wanted to
do this interview with him and when I
gave him the gold I promised to pay him
more money if he came back and did an
interview with me anyways because of the
recent blackouts in Venezuela I haven't
actually been able to get back in
contact with him since making that post
on the community tab of my channel he
ever does come back online though I will
pay him the money I promise the Pam and
heck will probably even do a second
video but this video focuses on a
website that you can go to don't do it
though it's against runescape rules but
that people go to and they pay for
Venezuelans to work on the runescape
accounts so the video is from the
perspective of the person who runs that
website and they live outside of
Venezuela but they have contacts and
offices within Venezuela running this
operation I took the opportunity to ask
him all sorts of questions like how the
business actually came to form how fair
the wages are for workers how the recent
blackout has affected the business and
the employees how the workers actually
get into providing these runescape
services what their working conditions
are like and why runescape is such a
popular game for Venezuelans to play and
then many more questions on top of that
and I think you're going to find his
responses really interesting now before
we get into this video I just have a
brief word from this video sponsor some
of you might remember around Christmas I
didn't interview with PIM de witte
former owner of the Soul split private

gameplay
and immediately share it to the world
look all you have to do is click the

something crazy happened in game you
combo down a noob you just got an

is press f8 clip saved and then you pull

it's free and it'll even upload the

before we get into the meat and potatoes
of this video I just want to give you a
depiction of what this service is
actually offering so you understand the
first thing to point out is the price so
it only cost 60 cents USD per hour of
the Venezuelan trainers time and that's
the price on the website so they're
getting even less than that because of
course some of that money is going to
the owners now to help me with this
explanation I also asked the owner to
give me his own description of their
service and this is what he told me
first off it was the sales pitch so he
said quote we offer an affordable
service for those seeking it they've
received over 10,000 hours of orders and
aim to be the number one service
provider more interestingly he told me
this he said that many of the existing
runescape service providers have higher
requirements aka that cost more money
because they're living in first world
countries but due to Venezuelans economy
they can offer incredible pricing which
anyone can afford and that's true the
most popular video on my channel is with
another runescape service provider
located in a first world country and
their prices are significantly higher he
wanted to tell me that their service is
actually creating a significant shift
in the old school runescape service
market and many players are welcoming
them and that's because of the
significantly reduced price ie the
Venezuelans are taking over the next
thing that I wanted to know is do you
have any special relation to Venezuela
I wanted to know this because I hope
that it would explain how he actually
started this service and he basically
told me no he said that all trainers are
Venezuelan it's not just the marketing
gimmick but the sales side of the
operation is run outside of Venezuela
and he is the sales side of the
operation so that led me into my next
question how did the idea for the
business come to mind and he told me
that he used to hire Venezuelans to work
on his own accounts and he did this
because they offered the best value per
dollar and that him and his now business
partner felt that there was a massive
opportunity and providing a service
where people could easily hire
Venezuelan workers to train their
accounts on top of that they proposed an
effective solution that is now known as
hourly pricing and of course hourly
pricing is known outside of this lots of
people get paid hourly but within the
runescape service black market hourly
pricing wasn't a thing really before the
service typically you pay so much money
per so much experience gained okay as
promised the meat and potatoes so I
asked him how fair are the wages for the
workers and he told me this he said that
the average wage in Venezuela is around
$10 per month and $15 if you're a doctor
that's in USD he said working for the
service a trainer can expect anywhere
from 100 to 250 dollars per month which
is equivalent to 10 to 25 regular
workers in Venezuela he said that our
highest performing trainer earns upwards
of 300 dollars per month which is
extremely good for a Venezuelan he said
that an experienced gold farmer you know
the ones that you see eight green
dragons are only earning around $60 a
month with higher risk when compared to
just working for them and what he means
by risk is the accounts being banned and
all the profit being
so what about the recent blackout in
Venezuela the one that's been all over
the news they don't have power they
can't access the internet specifically I
want to know how does it affect the
business and more importantly how does
it affect the employees in terms of the
business he told me that it doesn't
affect them much the majority of their
customers are loyal and they understand
the situation he said that there is
still a blackout as he types this and
that it hurts the trainers but they
prepare for such conditions as a service
as for the employees he said this for
anyone living in Venezuela it is a big
struggle right now with numerous
electricity issues amongst rampant crime
and poverty he told me that he helps set
up this service as a way to give those
lucky enough to work for it the means to
live a much healthier life he wanted to
say that is a very very sad situation
and that every order they received makes
a massive difference in these workers
lives and you know I think that's where
the community is tied in part we see
these Venezuelans farming Green Dragons
getting in the way of our gameplay but
at the same time they're literally
putting food on their family's tables
the next thing that I really wanted to
know is how do your workers get into
providing services for runescape are
they recruited and trained or do they
already have some experience he started
off by telling me that the recruitment
process is rigorous all of their
trainers are close friends or relatives
of his business partner and the reason
for this is that sometimes they have to
be trusted with really highly valued
accounts they obviously don't want the
gold or the account stolen he also
wanted to tell me that they value the
health and well-being of their trainers
along with the long-term future of them
staying with the service he wanted to
say that many of the trainers who
currently work for them have years of
experience playing old school runescape
their ex gold farmers the ones that you
see at blue green dragons wherever else
farming gold they've you know found them
through their personal connections and
they've recruited them to come work for
them for even more money he also told me
that 99% of the people in Venezuela were
in this game farming field are teenagers
and they farm all sorts of games not
just dreamscape for cash and so you know
finding people that have that old school
runescape experience isn't that far and
few between there's quite a few of them
one of the people that actually
responded to the community post I talked
about at the beginning of this video was
a Venezuelan saying that this game saved
his life for three years when he was
still in Venezuela trying to make ends
meet so what about the working
conditions what type of computers are
these employees playing runescape on and
where are they playing runescape from he
told me that many of the trainers work
from home using government-issued
laptops and low-end computers on top of
that they actually have one real office
in Venezuela with two more on the way
that some workers work out of and within
those office they have machines that can
run a maximum of four old school
runescape clients at a time so not very
powerful machines at all I was also
curious about why runescape is such a
popular game for Venezuelans to play for
money and they gave me a couple of
reasons for that
so we said number one there is a
guaranteed demand for old school
runescape GP number two the requirements
to enter the market is low you don't
need a good computer membership doesn't
cost a whole lot you don't have to buy a
bunch of expansions like for world of
warcraft makes it really easy for them
to start they can play for free and then
finally the market for services in the
game what this company is offering is
much higher than for other games there's
a lot of people looking to purchase
these black market services so I was
curious about how steady the work is for
these Venezuelans and he told me this
you said that their queue time speaks
for itself so that currently there's a
one to three week waiting time for in
order to even start and that means that
they can be really picky and choosey in
the orders that they actually take on so
they take the easy orders that are gonna
pay the most money so I've also done
some math for you on their website it
says they've been around since September
of 2018 that means the service has been
alive for 204
teen days they also say that they've
done over 11,000 hours worth of training
now that works out to an average of 51
hours worth of training per day since
they started now keep in mind nobody
starts out with you know customers so
the amount of training that they do now
per day is likely much higher than just
51 hours anyways with employees running
a max of four clients per computer you
know many probably less than that the
ones using the government laptop might
only be able to run one client they
definitely have a good amount of
employee who's higher training accounts
as a full-time job like he said these
people are earning between 100 and 250
dollars per month working for them
training in Skype accounts one of my
final questions was what are the
challenges imposed by jagex on your
operation and he told me this he said
quote if you compare us the botting
operations or a gold selling website we
don't have any issues he wanted to say
that however their number one issue is
false banned detection z' he told me
that these false bands quote highlight
that Jagex doesn't know what they're
doing he said it's proof that Jagex has
a bad detection system for legitimate
play okay here's the thing so these
accounts that they're playing on
although he said it only happens rarely
are getting banned while they're playing
on them and the customer assumes a
hundred percent responsibility for
getting that band revoked if it does
happen he said it's like that for all
services what I find funny is that he's
so dead set on the idea that it's not
because they're you know running a
service that violates the runescape
rules that they're getting banned he's
so set on the idea that they're getting
banned because Jagex has a poor bot

that's the case I think you know the
reality of this is that these accounts
are getting banned because Jagex knows
that some sort of unfair play is
happening on them often what people tell
me on their own is the most interesting
so I decided to finish off the interview
by asking him if there was anything else
he wanted to tell me and there's two
things that he told me that I really
want to include the first is that
said the overall scale of the
underground old school runescape
industry is really something you have to
be a part of to grasp the size of he
said that it's a multi-million dollar
market and it's highly competitive
between businesses he also told me that
their service does not exploit the
trainers he said that they offer a means
to lead a healthier life he also said
that from his experience unfortunately
many trainers for other services do get
exploited for example there are those
who are getting $30 a month while the
operator receives over $200 for their
efforts he also said that there are many
legitimate companies operating in this
space in Venezuela but you know for
every legitimate company there's another
that's exploiting people for profit he
said that it's very concerning but
there's nothing that he can personally
do unfortunately anyways that's it for
the interview I was really excited to
get the opportunity to do this I reached
out and the guy said gasps right away
and he gave me these answers back you
know within hours of me sending off the

whether these Venezuelan should be even
